document_data.name: Urcandle Alley
document_data.mainbody: '''Urcandle Alley''' was a short alleyway of hard-packed dirt and [[gravel]] in the [[Waterdeep/Trades Ward|Trades Ward]] of [[Waterdeep]], named for an individual who had long been forgotten by the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Geography: This alleyway ran due south off of the [[Court of the White Bull]] and terminated on [[Sorn Street]].
document_data.Activities:
Urcandle Alley was home to one of the greatest concentrations of wheelwright stores in Waterdeep. They sold a wide variety of cables, drovers [[whip]]s, [[harness]]es, reins, [[rope]]s, cables, spare [[wagon]] wheels, and other such wheelwright items.

All this wagon related activity also made Urcandle Alley a frequent meeting spot for members of the [[Wheelwrights' Guild]] and the [[Wagon-makers' and Coach Builders' Guild]].
